Degrees & Professional Development
The School of Extended and International Education offers a multitude of academic credit and degree programs to meet student needs. We take pride in creating learning opportunities for career advancement and personal growth. Many courses are scheduled weekends, evenings, and online. 


Summer Session/Winter Intersession
Summer Session offers SSU and visiting students the opportunity to take classes over the summer during three 4-week sessions and one 12-week session. Winter Intersession offers students the opportunity to take a full-credit class over the winter break. (also see Open University/Open Door)


Osher Lifelong Learning Institute
OLLI is a unique learning community for adults age 50 years old or better. We offer the very best continuing education with no tests and no grades. Distinguished SSU faculty and other Bay Area educators enjoy sharing their expertise with OLLI students.


International Programs
We have friendly, knowledgeable staff who serve our international student population. SSU offers a wealth of programs designed for international students to enjoy exploring and studying in beautiful Northern California.


Online Learning Center
In partnership with trusted online educational providers, we offer affordable, self-paced online programs that meet the needs of today's working professional. If you are looking to expand your skill set for an in-demand career, our Online Learning Center will accommodate your busy schedule.


Excel for Youth
The EXCEL for Youth Program offers students entering grades 3-7 a unique opportunity for academic enrichment in accelerated classes that focus on science, technology and the arts. 


Contract Credit/Extension Courses
Contract credit is awarded for contracted professional development, as for teacher training when the CSU does not provide the actual instruction but does administer the awarding of credit. Extension courses are one way SSU offers university level academic credit resources to the wider community. The courses offer either academic credits, CEUs, or both.


Open University/Open Door
Open University and Open Door offer the opportunity for anyone to enroll in a course without being admitted to the CSU. You can take courses for personal enrichment or start your college career. Open University and Open Door give you the flexibility to take courses on a space-available basis and earn college credit.

    SEIE Connects Partners Across Campus  










Dr. Jordan Rose





Dr. Brian S. Wilson





Erin Ringstad





Disability Services for Students






I am a graduate of this very FNP program and enjoyed being here so much that I decided to return to teach after developing my practice in a local community clinic. My research focuses on technology, nutrition, and education and I still like to keep my clinical practice current by providing care to students at the SSU Student Health Center.

 

Jordan Rose, DNP, M.S, B.A, A.D, works as a faculty member in the Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP) program at Sonoma State University and enjoys volunteering as a faculty mentor for first-year students. He also loves being outdoors at the river or ocean with his two boys.
Title | Faculty Coordinator, Post-Master's Family Nurse Practitioner Certificate program.
 






 SEIE is helping to extend the borders of the Department of Music to international countries such as China by supporting and partnering with Music’s outreach efforts.

 
Brian S. Wilson, DMA, is a master educator, and has worked with SSU for over 19 years. He has instructed courses in music theory and composition, conducting, orchestration, arranging, methods classes and European Music Survey. 
Title | Department: Past Chair and Professor, Department of Music, and Director of Jewish Studies Program.
 






 It is always a pleasure to work with SEIE. Their essential registration and scheduling support has helped raise the overall quality of our programs and the experience of the students in our program.

 
Erin Ringstad manages the day-to-day operations for the Graduate & Executive Business Programs in the School of Business & Economics. Erin’s previous experience in higher education administration and production in the wine industry contribute to her role in the development of innovative professional development education programs tailored to the needs of business professionals with careers in the growing wine industry.
Title | Department: Operations Manager, Graduate & Executive Business Programs, School of Business & Economics
 






 SEIE staff provided DSS with the opportunity to test-drive a Live Chat service that Extended Ed holds a few licenses to.  In the time we have been testing it on our own website, SEIE has provided endless support and collaboration, and always with a positive attitude.  They not only took the time to develop a very thorough instructional email for our department, but they made themselves available via zoom and g-chats multiple times.  Not once have we reached out to them and had they disregard us, or make us feel like they don't have time for our many questions.  When we ask for direction, almost without fail, they go above and beyond and provides us any necessary links or screenshots that we don't even realize we need.

 

Title | Department: Brent Boyer, DSS  Director; JoAnne Jaggars, Administrative Support Coordinator; Stephanie Graham, Accessibility Specialist, Disability Services for Students
